frontmatter.title: Museo de la Alhambra
frontmatter.description: Museo de la Alhambra - This museum is located in the south wing of the ground floor of the palace of Charles V in the Alhambra . It houses objects, furnishings, books and architectural remains of Hispano-Muslim art dating from the mid- eighth century to the last years of the Nasrid culture.
tags: Top things to do in Andalusia when it rains

frontmatter.title: Museo del Grabado Español Contemporáneo de Marbella
frontmatter.description: Museo del Grabado Español Contemporáneo de Marbella - The museum is set in a building in the beautiful historical center of Marbella, and houses works by Miró, Saura, Picasso and Goya.
tags: Top things to do with kids in Costa del Sol
Top things to do in Andalusia when it rains

frontmatter.title: Museum Jorge Rando
frontmatter.description: Museum Jorge Rando - Open museum in a nice building about ten minutes walk from the center of Malaga. This is a museum that is unique in its genre in Spain. Expressionism dedicated to the painter Jorge Rando.
tags: Top Free Things to do with Kids in Andalusia
Top things to do with kids in Malaga
Top things to do in Andalusia when it rains

frontmatter.title: Museum of Cadiz
frontmatter.description: Museum of Cadiz - A museum located in Cadiz. Founded in 1970 after the merger of the Provincial Museum of Fine Arts and the Provincial Museum of Archaeology. The museum holds a collection of contemporary art and archaeology.
tags: Top things to do in Andalusia when it rains
Top things to do with kids in Cadiz

frontmatter.title: Museum of Fine Arts in Córdoba
frontmatter.description: Museum of Fine Arts in Córdoba -  Situated in the same building as the Julio Romero de Torres Museum. It is a small museum with a collection of paintings by different authors, from the seventeenth century to modern times. The museum also have a few pieces by Julio Romero.
tags: Top Free Things to do with Kids in Andalusia
Top things to do in Andalusia when it rains

frontmatter.title: Muy Guemes
frontmatter.description: Muy Guemes - Is a gastronomic and commercial center, located in the heart of Güemes neighborhood and resembles Buenos Aires' Soho district. This gallery combines shopping areas, beautiful restaurants such as "La casa de fuego" and "El Mentidero" and nice little bars for a drink.

frontmatter.title: Málaga Nostrum Commercial Park
frontmatter.description: Málaga Nostrum Commercial Park - Although this Málaga shopping centre is not located in the city centre, Málaga Nostrum is a great place for shopping enthusiasts. Pick up some bargains from the factory outlet with discounts up to 70% off brands such as Levi's, Mango, Desigual, Spagnolo, Fifty Factory and Mustang. In addition, there is an entertainment zone with a bowling alley and a multitude of restaurants.

frontmatter.title: Málaga Plaza Shopping Centre
frontmatter.description: Málaga Plaza Shopping Centre - Plaza Mayor is the local's favourite shopping mall. It has easy parking and is a well run and safe commercial centre with restaurants, good cinema with movies in English, shops and a large supermarket.
tags: Top things to do in Andalusia when it rains

frontmatter.title: Natura Dive Center
frontmatter.description: Natura Dive Center - Training divers at all levels - from the Open Water course that will allow you to start diving, to advanced training that will turn you into a diving instructor.
tags: Top things to do with kids in Costa del Sol

frontmatter.title: Nerjadiving
frontmatter.description: Nerjadiving - Training scuba divers at all levels.
tags: Top things to do with kids in Costa del Sol

frontmatter.title: Nervión Plaza
frontmatter.description: Nervión Plaza - This Shopping Center is located next to the Ramon Sanchez Pizjuan Stadium, it has three floors with shops, cinemas, restaurants and parking.

frontmatter.title: Nicolas Valiente School of Dance
frontmatter.description: Nicolas Valiente School of Dance - The school is located in the center of Marbella, near Plaza del Mar, below the Casa Nostra restaurant. At this dance school you can learn Salsa , Bachata , Cha Cha, Belly Dance and Argentinian Tango. There is no iage restriction for dancers! They offer classes for children , youth and adults. Everyone is welcome!

frontmatter.title: Open Viñuela Mall
frontmatter.description: Open Viñuela Mall - This is one of the "open malls" in Andalusia. It is an urban area with shops, restaurants and other commercial offices. Mostly family-run merchants, this is a pleaseant shopping experience.

frontmatter.title: Palacio Viana
frontmatter.description: Palacio Viana - Located a short walk from the centre of Cordoba. This aristocratic palace is full of art and antiques and although the guide's presentation is in Spanish there are English information sheets in the rooms.
tags: Top things to do in Cordoba

frontmatter.title: Paloma Park
frontmatter.description: Paloma Park - This 200,000m2 park is located in the centre of Benalmadena and boasts beautiful garden areas as well as a large lake in the centre.
tags: Top Free Things to do with Kids in Andalusia
Top things to do with kids in Costa del Sol

frontmatter.title: Parador de Málaga Golf
frontmatter.description: Parador de Málaga Golf - Located outside of the city of Malaga and very close to the airport and the Plaza Mayor shopping center. Over the years, this course - the oldest in Andalusia - has been transformed into one that is both demanding for professional players and accessible for newbies.
tags: Top golf courses Costa del Sol

frontmatter.title: Parque Aquatico Vera Almeria
frontmatter.description: Parque Aquatico Vera Almeria - This water park is located in Vera in northern Almeria province, near Mojacar.
tags: Top things to do with kids in Almeria

frontmatter.title: Parque Deportivo La Garza
frontmatter.description: Parque Deportivo La Garza -  This is a sports and recreational publicly owned complex of the Junta de Andalucía, located 7 km from Linares. It has a 9-hole golf course with lighting and putting green , three outdoor swimming pools , artificial turf soccer field, two tennis courts , a covered sports hall , sports court, artificial turf football pitch, four paddle tennis courts all with lighting, a climbing wall and an outdoor gym circuit. At present the smal 5-hole golf course has two par-5 holes, two par-3s and a par-4. It has a green-fee and arrangements with the Hotels Victoria, Cervantes and Anibal in Linares.

frontmatter.title: Patio Olmos
frontmatter.description: Patio Olmos - This mall is located in the very heart of Córdoba city. For those eager to spend some money, national and international brands have branches in Patio Olmos. There are also cinemas, a play area, and an eating lounge with quite a varied amount of restaurants on offer.

frontmatter.title: Pedalo Fun
frontmatter.description: Pedalo Fun - You can rent a pedalo for half an hour or an hour along most beaches along the coast.
tags: Top things to do in Costa del Sol
Top things to do with kids in Costa del Sol
Top things to do with kids in Cadiz

frontmatter.title: Piedra Paloma beach
frontmatter.description: Piedra Paloma beach - Located in the municipality of Casares. This is a beautiful and well-maintained beach with good facilities. It is more than two kilometers long and has gravel and dark sand. There are rocks and is ideal for a play date with your dog.

frontmatter.title: Pirate Parasailing & Water Sports Fuengirola
frontmatter.description: Pirate Parasailing & Water Sports Fuengirola  - If you are a thrill-seeker and would like to experience the beautiful views of the Costa del Sol's coastline, try parasailing. This is not for those of you afraid of heights.
tags: Top things to do in Costa del Sol
Top things to do with kids in Costa del Sol

frontmatter.title: Playa Mini Golf
frontmatter.description: Playa Mini Golf - Now the Blue Kiwi and Mini Golf. In 2018 they are celebrating 20 years which is a testament to their presence in Benalmadena.
tags: Top things to do with kids in Costa del Sol

frontmatter.title: Playa de la Rana
frontmatter.description: Playa de la Rana -  Located in a natural area in the municipality of Adra (Almería), this is the only beach for dogs in Almería.  It is a beautiful wild beach, several kilometers long and has dark sand and pebbles. The beach is 350m long and not suitable for swimming.

frontmatter.title: Playa del Castillo
frontmatter.description: Playa del Castillo - This canine beach in Fuengirola, situated in the shadow of Sohail Castle, has fine white sand. It is a relatively small beach, but a nice place to go for a walk with your dog.

frontmatter.title: Plaza Costa del Sol
frontmatter.description: Plaza Costa del Sol - The square is located in the center of Torremolinos and is a pedestrianized zone with a great variety of bars and restaurants. There is also a large shopping area where you can find everything, including crafts, electronics, clothing, shoes, gifts etc.

frontmatter.title: Plaza De Abastos Los Remedios
frontmatter.description: Plaza De Abastos Los Remedios - A local market that sells anything from fish to appliances. This market is a little gem, but hidden away on all four entry sides between tall buildings. The market also has a bar situated in the middle.

frontmatter.title: Plaza de Armas
frontmatter.description: Plaza de Armas - Situated in the Cordoba bus station, The Plaza de Armas has been renovated a while ago, and is now a pleasant shopping centre with cinemas, restaurants, cafes, shops, and also house the NH Hotel Plaza de Armas.

frontmatter.title: Puerto Marina Shopping
frontmatter.description: Puerto Marina Shopping - The thing that stands out about the Puerto Marina Shopping Center is the beautiful view of the harbor. There are a few restaurants, jewellery shops, a small supermarket (SuperCor), a few souvenir shops and a Vietnamese nail boutique.

frontmatter.title: Quadbike safari costa del sol
frontmatter.description: Quadbike safari costa del sol - Take an adventure in an off-road buggy and experience the breathtaking Andalusian countryside.
tags: Top things to do in Costa del Sol
Top things to do with kids in Costa del Sol

frontmatter.title: Que Bowling Mijas
frontmatter.description: Que Bowling Mijas - A fun activity for all the family. There are a couple of bowling alleys in Andalusia.
tags: Top things to do in Andalusia when it rains
Top things to do with kids in Costa del Sol

frontmatter.title: Real Alcazar Seville
frontmatter.description: Real Alcazar Seville - This monument were declared as a World Heritage Site by UNESCO in 1987 and represents the historical evolution of the city of Seville in the last millennium. Influences by different cultures is highly noticeable starting from the Arabic period, late Middle Ages Mudéjar right through to the Renaissance, Baroque and the XIX century.
tags: Top things to do in Seville

frontmatter.title: Real Club Pineda de Sevilla
frontmatter.description: Real Club Pineda de Sevilla - Located 3 km from Seville, is a 18-hole golf course where visitors can play if accompanied by a member. Plain course with three lakes and bunkers. Wide fairways are separated by pine trees and palm trees. Small, flat greens are surrounded by water hazards.

frontmatter.title: Real Club Sevilla Golf
frontmatter.description: Real Club Sevilla Golf - This club was the venue of the 2004 World Cup, the headquarters of the 2008 and 2010 Spanish Open and the Andalusian Open 2009, and has one of the best courses in Europe. Located in Alcala de Guadaira next to the bank of the Guadaíra River and the Oromana Natural Park, and not too far from the center of the city of Seville. This is a beautiful golf course with a good design and is superbly maintained.

frontmatter.title: Real Club Valderrama
frontmatter.description: Real Club Valderrama - This is a private golf club which allows non-members every day from 10h00 to 12h00 to play its magnificent golf course. The course is maintained well and in perfect condition. There is a Club House with all the facilities you need, a well equipped pro shop and a restaurant with very good food and service.

frontmatter.title: Real Club de Golf Las Brisas
frontmatter.description: Real Club de Golf Las Brisas - Located in the heart of Nueva Andalucia, in the so-called Golf Valley, is the Real Las Brisas Golf Club, one of the most traditional courses of the Costa del Sol. The course has a multiple of obstacles of water, in example ten artificial lakes fed by two streams. The greens are mostly high and protected by bunkers.The terrace restaurant/bar is great and very fairly priced whilst the service is lovely and the view, even more-so.
tags: Top golf courses Costa del Sol

frontmatter.title: Real Club de Golf Sotogrande
frontmatter.description: Real Club de Golf Sotogrande - Located in golf‘s golden mile between the Guadiaro River and the Sotogrande Marina, the course was inaugurated in 1964. The layout has well-established vegetation with pine, cork oaks, eucalyptus and palm trees, and water hazards play an important role, affecting holes 12, 13 and 14, and 16 and 17. The club hosts the annual Sherry Cup-European Amateur Golf Masters.

frontmatter.title: Real Club de Golf Vista Hermosa
frontmatter.description: Real Club de Golf Vista Hermosa - Situated in the Bay of Cádiz, just past El Puerto de Santa María. The golf course has small fairways and the greens are protected by sand obstacles. It's proximity to the coast, makes the east wind an obstacle for players too.

frontmatter.title: Real Club de Tenis Betis
frontmatter.description: Real Club de Tenis Betis - One of the oldest leisure clubs in Spain. The club has 6 tennis courts, 1 artificial grass football pitch, 2 padel courts, a gym with exercise classes, a swimming pool and restaurant.
tags: Top Things to do with kids in Seville

frontmatter.title: Real Maestranza
frontmatter.description: Real Maestranza - The Bullring of the Real Maestranza de Caballería de Sevilla is a monument considered to be the most important square relevant to the greatest bullfighting tradition in Spain. One of the most relevant collections of bullfighting art at universal level are kept here.
tags: Top things to do in Seville

frontmatter.title: Red Tide Charter - Whale watching
frontmatter.description: Red Tide Charter - Whale watching - Boat trips and also fishing trips in Puerto Banus, Marbella. With all equipment, bait, licenses, beverages, etc included.
tags: Top things to do with kids in Costa del Sol

frontmatter.title: Residencial Computer Service
frontmatter.description: Residencial Computer Service - A Marbella based company that offers tuition in hardware and software products.

frontmatter.title: Rosaleda Shopping Centre
frontmatter.description: Rosaleda Shopping Centre - There are plenty of shops to wander in & out of over the 2 floors, with a choice of eateries as well.
tags: Top things to do in Andalusia when it rains

frontmatter.title: SEK-Alboran International School, Almeria
frontmatter.description: SEK-Alboran International School, Almeria - Situated in Almunecar. The school is located in the Almerimar residential estate (El Ejido), next to the Punta Entinas nature park and facing the sea. SEK-Alborán is one of the 9 schools making up SEK International Schools. Co-ed day (0-18 years). English National Curriculum education.

frontmatter.title: Salon Varietés Theatre
frontmatter.description: Salon Varietés Theatre - An English speaking theatre in the centre of Fuengirola, that puts on a high level of performances. They also have pantos at Christmas. Book your tickets online.
tags: Top things to do in Andalusia when it rains
Top things to do with kids in Costa del Sol

frontmatter.title: San Pedro de Alcantara Feria (October)
frontmatter.description: San Pedro de Alcantara Feria (October) - During the spring and summer months, many of the local towns and cities celebrate their local ‘ferias’ (fairs). Lasting anything from 5 days to 10 days, they all feature fun fairs in the evenings with lots of rides and activities for all the family
tags: Top things to do with kids in Malaga

frontmatter.title: San Roque Club
frontmatter.description: San Roque Club - Situated near Cadiz, with a clubhouse that is a charming old farmhouse, surrounded by gorges and lakes, the two golf courses at this location are both spectacular. Both are quite different. The old course is a jewel with each hole different and challenging. Specifically 11, 13 and 18 are exceptional. The new course offers different challenges with more ripples, lots of bunkers and water.

frontmatter.title: Sancti Petri Hills Golf
frontmatter.description: Sancti Petri Hills Golf -  Situated at the highest part of the Playa de La Barrosa beach, next to the Novo Sancti Petri residential estate, in the municipality of  Chiclana de la Frontera. It is a short field of 18 holes but quite technical and fun. The field is very well taken care of. The clubhouse prepares good food and have friendly staff.

frontmatter.title: Sanlucar Club de Campo
frontmatter.description: Sanlucar Club de Campo -  Located on the top of a hill n the region of Las Lomas de Martín Miguel, in the municipality of Sanlúcar de Barrameda and you can enjoy the views of the Guadalquivir River and the Coto de Doñana while playing golf. Opened in 2008, this course -second stage of the Marbella Club Golf Resort- has 9 holes at the moment, but it is planned to extend it to 18. It is a competition course, surrounded by several lakes. The course is flat, easy to walk, with undulating greens, but is not excessively difficult.

frontmatter.title: Santa Clara Golf Club Marbella
frontmatter.description: Santa Clara Golf Club Marbella - This is one of Marbella’s most exclusive golf courses. This is a nice course set in the natural surrounding hills. Some very tough holes but overall very good. The course has wide fairways, medium sized greens and almost no rough to speak of. It also has its own version of an ‘Amen corner’ - Santa Clara Corner - a long downhill par four followed by a 200 yard+ par three and finishing off with a 600 yard par 5. Finish your round with a beer in the spectacular Club house, sit on the terrace and reflect where those six shot went that could have made you the winner on the day.
tags: Top golf courses Costa del Sol

frontmatter.title: Santa Clara Golf Granada
frontmatter.description: Santa Clara Golf Granada - Situated only a few minutes away from the center of Granada and half an hour drive from both the Sierra Nevada’s ski station and the Costa Tropical. Without a doubt one of the best golf courses in Granada. This is a long and fairly difficult course. It is an interesting course with many unusual features, such as the blind green on the 4th hole. There are stunning views of the Sierra Nevada from most holes and an excellent restaurant in the Clubhouse.

frontmatter.title: Santa Maria Golf & Country Club
frontmatter.description: Santa Maria Golf & Country Club -  Santa Maria Golf is situated in Marbella. The first nine holes are shorter and more complicated than the back nine which are flatter and have wider fairways. Greens are generally spacious. For those in needed of extra tuition the Diego Morito Golf School has one of the best reputations on the coast. Santa María has a magnificent clubhouse, tennis courts, swimming pool and its own lawn bowls rink and club.
tags: Top golf courses Costa del Sol

frontmatter.title: Santana Golf and Country Club
frontmatter.description: Santana Golf and Country Club - Set in an old Avocado plantation, there is a good mix of mature trees, fruit bushes and a fair amount of water on this golf course. There is wide fairways, beautifully manicured greens and golf is played at a pace which is neither too fast nor too slow. Buggies are allowed on the fairway and a refreshment buggy also drives around the course. Great small clubhouse with very friendly staff for a meal afterwards.
tags: Top golf courses Costa del Sol

frontmatter.title: Saturday - Marbella - Ecological Market
frontmatter.description: Saturday - Marbella - Ecological Market - On the first Saturday of every month between 10am and 2pm, Marbella’s Alameda Park is the setting for an ecological market. Stalls sell locally sourced, environmentally friendly produce at competitive prices, and the green spaces of the Alameda make browsing here a pleasure.
tags: Top Free Things to do with Kids in Andalusia

frontmatter.title: Scuba Tours
frontmatter.description: Scuba Tours - Sunset Beach Club hotel has their own PADI Dive Centre and Dive Shack onsite. They offer courses from beginner to advanced; they start off with lessons in the pool and then you can make your way out to one of the dive spots located just off the beach next to the hotel.
tags: Top things to do with kids in Costa del Sol

frontmatter.title: Sealife Aquarium
frontmatter.description: Sealife Aquarium - Vist this aquarium in Benalmadena to See sharks, jellyfish, giant turtles, sea rays, a giant Pacific octopus and lots of other fascinating underwater creatures.
tags: Top things to do in Costa del Sol
Top things to do with kids in Costa del Sol

frontmatter.title: Selwo Aventura Wildlife Park in Estepona
frontmatter.description: Selwo Aventura Wildlife Park in Estepona - The largest wildlife park on the Costa del Sol. See large animals roaming in the wild.
tags: Top things to do in Costa del Sol
Top things to do with kids in Costa del Sol

frontmatter.title: Selwo Marina
frontmatter.description: Selwo Marina - The only Dolphinarium in Andalusia and one of the most popular attractions located in in the centre of Arroyo de la Miel (Benalmadena)
tags: Top things to do in Costa del Sol
Top things to do with kids in Costa del Sol

frontmatter.title: Serrallo Plaza
frontmatter.description: Serrallo Plaza - Located a short distance from the most visited monument in Spain. This shopping center has a variety of shops, restaurants and even supermarket.

frontmatter.title: Sherry Golf Jerez
frontmatter.description: Sherry Golf Jerez - This golf course is located 1.5 Km from Jerez town centre, only 10 minutes from Jerez airport, 50 minutes from Seville airport and just 12 minutes from the beach. The facilities includes a pro-shop, clubs room, changing room, terrace grill, cafeteria, and restaurant. The golf course is suitable for both amateurs and professionals.

frontmatter.title: Sierra de Segura Club de Golf
frontmatter.description: Sierra de Segura Club de Golf - A 9-hole golf course that starts and ends at the same point.  It is characterized by the unevenness of the greens and the main difficulty is the bunkers that flank the greens.

frontmatter.title: Simply Diving
frontmatter.description: Simply Diving - A British-run PADI 5 Star Career Development and IDC Dive Centres in Spain. Catering for all scuba diving levels from beginner to advance. Sister school in Marbella.
tags: Top things to do with kids in Costa del Sol

frontmatter.title: Simply Diving Marbella
frontmatter.description: Simply Diving Marbella - A British-run PADI 5 Star Career Development and IDC Dive Centres in Spain. Catering for all scuba diving levels from beginner to advance. Sister schoolin Torremolinos.
tags: Top things to do with kids in Costa del Sol

frontmatter.title: Sotogrande International School
frontmatter.description: Sotogrande International School - IS is an International Baccalaureate day and boarding school. Primary Years Programme (3-11), the Middle Years Programme (12-16) and the Diploma (16-18), plus outstanding language and learning support.

frontmatter.title: Spain Wine School
frontmatter.description: Spain Wine School - Offering professional private and corporate fun and engaging wine tasting events, Wine education (introductory or advanced tutoring), Sherry education and tasting, wine lists, consulting and exporting wines. The Spanish Wine Experience education program is a Spanish wine course designed to provide professionals and enthusiasts of wine with the most advanced and comprehensive specialization study program on the wines of Spain.

frontmatter.title: St Anthony's College
frontmatter.description: St Anthony's College - Situated in Mijas Costa, perfect for people living in Mijas, Fuengirola, Coin and Alhaurin el Grande. Ages 3-18, co-ed day school; an officially recognised bilingual school offering an English curriculum with GCSEs at 16  and a wide range of A Levels at 18.

frontmatter.title: St George's British School - Almeria
frontmatter.description: St George's British School - Almeria - Situated in Almeria. Co-ed day (3-18 years). English National Curriculum education, n conjunction with obligatory elements of the Spanish curriculum. They study a wide range of subjects from the British curriculum and, in addition, Spanish language and humanities.

frontmatter.title: St George's British School - Malaga
frontmatter.description: St George's British School - Malaga - Situated in Malaga. Co-ed day (3-18 years). English National Curriculum education, in conjunction with obligatory elements of the Spanish curriculum. They study a wide range of subjects from the British curriculum and, in addition, Spanish language and humanities.

frontmatter.title: St George's British School - Seville
frontmatter.description: St George's British School - Seville - Situated in Seville. Co-ed day (3-18 years). English National Curriculum education, n conjunction with obligatory elements of the Spanish curriculum. They study a wide range of subjects from the British curriculum and, in addition, Spanish language and humanities.

frontmatter.title: St George’s British School of Malaga
frontmatter.description: St George’s British School of Malaga - Close to Gibraltar, this is the southernmost international school on the Costa del Sol. Co-ed day (ages 3-18 years) and boarding (ages 11-18). It is the only international boarding school in Southern Spain).

frontmatter.title: Stage Coach Theatre Arts School
frontmatter.description: Stage Coach Theatre Arts School - A part-time performing arts school, teaching English speaking 4 to 16 year-old children and teenagers singing, dancing and acting. This is not only to perform on stage but also, more importantly, to perform better in life. Schools are located in Fuengirola and Marbella.

frontmatter.title: Sunday - Coin - Organic Market
frontmatter.description: Sunday - Coin - Organic Market - This market is situated beside La Trocha shopping centre to the north of the town centre and sells organic fruit and vegetables.
tags: Top Free Things to do with Kids in Andalusia

frontmatter.title: Sunday - Coin weekly carboot market
frontmatter.description: Sunday - Coin weekly carboot market - Every Sunday in the parking of the La Trocha shopping center.
tags: Top Free Things to do with Kids in Andalusia

frontmatter.title: Sunland International School
frontmatter.description: Sunland International School - Situated in Cartama, around 20km inland from Malaga. Co-ed day (ages 3-18 years) English curriculum, (SATS  ages 11 and 14, and IGCSEs).

frontmatter.title: Sunny View School
frontmatter.description: Sunny View School - Situated in Torremolinos, Co-ed day school. Ages 3-18. Pre-School, Primary and Secondary Schools. Complete English National Curriculum education, including GCSE from ages 14-16, A Levels from 16-18.

frontmatter.title: Susana Fernandez Blanco
frontmatter.description: Susana Fernandez Blanco - Drawing and painting lessons at home for any age and ability, covering all areas of art.

frontmatter.title: Swans International School (Primary)
frontmatter.description: Swans International School (Primary) - Situated in Marbella. Children from ages 3-12. 300 pupils. English National Curriculum plus full Spanish Primary course in language and humanities.

frontmatter.title: Swans Sierra Blanca (Secondary School)
frontmatter.description: Swans Sierra Blanca (Secondary School) - Situated in Marbella. Co-ed day ages 11-18. It offers IGCSE, and since Sept 2008 provides the full IB diploma to Sixth Form students. It offers a wide range of extra-curricular activities.

frontmatter.title: Synagogue
frontmatter.description: Synagogue - This small synagogue is situated in the Jewish Quarter of Córdoba and was built in 1315. It was possibly the private synagogue of a wealthy man, as indicated by its small size. Another possibility is that this was the synagogue of a trade guild, which converted a residence or one of the work rooms into the synagogue.
tags: Top things to do in Cordoba

frontmatter.title: Teatro Romano
frontmatter.description: Teatro Romano - This theatre is located at the entrance to the Alcazaba. This is a small theatre by Roman standards but nevertheless still impressive. There are lots of informational readings around the site.
tags: Top things to do in Malaga

frontmatter.title: The British College Benalmadena
frontmatter.description: The British College Benalmadena - A 5 minute walk from Torremuelle train station on the Fuengirola - Malaga line. Co-ed (5-18 years) day school. English National Curriculum. Students do IGCSEs for ages 14-16, A/S Levels at 17, and A Levels at 18.

frontmatter.title: The English International College
frontmatter.description: The English International College - Situated at Las Chapas, close to Marbella. Around 500. Co-ed day (3-18 years). English National Curriculum education. It provides SATS tests for ages 7, 11, and 14, IGCSEs and A Levels.

frontmatter.title: The Hawaiians SUP Center - Stand Up Paddle
frontmatter.description: The Hawaiians SUP Center - Stand Up Paddle - A water sport that the whole family can enjoy. SUP is a fun activity you can practice at various locations along the Costa del Sol.
tags: Top things to do with kids in Costa del Sol

frontmatter.title: The International School Estepona (Primary School)
frontmatter.description: The International School Estepona (Primary School) - Situated in Benavista, Estepona, near Marbella. Children from ages 2-12. English National Curriculum. Montessori for ages 2-5.

frontmatter.title: Thursday - San Pedro de Alcántara Market
frontmatter.description: Thursday - San Pedro de Alcántara Market - Located at the San Pedro de Alcántara fairground, this market is a food and flea market comprising of around 230 stalls.
tags: Top Free Things to do with Kids in Andalusia

frontmatter.title: Thursday Alhaurin el Grande street market
frontmatter.description: Thursday Alhaurin el Grande street market - Small street market where you can buy mainly clothes and shoes. There is also a stall selling fruit and vegetables. Free parking is available in the area.
tags: Top Free Things to do with Kids in Andalusia

frontmatter.title: Thursday- Torremolinos street market
frontmatter.description: Thursday- Torremolinos street market - The market is in the Sports/Cultural area behind the Town Hall. Mostly sells clothes, underwear, and some Moroccan leather goods.
tags: Top Free Things to do with Kids in Andalusia

frontmatter.title: Tivoli World
frontmatter.description: Tivoli World - The Costa del Sol's longest running amusement park. Fun for all the family! Great variety of rides for all ages.
tags: Top things to do with kids in Costa del Sol

frontmatter.title: Torre del Oro
frontmatter.description: Torre del Oro - This "Tower of Gold" is a 36 meter high tower that are located on the left bank of the rio-guadalquivir, in the city of Seville. It is right next to the bullring of the Real Maestranza. It's name is owed to the golden reflections produced by the tiles that covers it.
tags: Top things to do in Seville

frontmatter.title: Torremolinos Feria (September)
frontmatter.description: Torremolinos Feria (September) - During the spring and summer months, many of the local towns and cities celebrate their local ‘ferias’ (fairs). Lasting anything from 5 days to 10 days, they all feature fun fairs in the evenings with lots of rides and activities for all the family
tags: Top things to do in Costa del Sol
Top things to do with kids in Malaga

frontmatter.title: Tuesday and Saturday Fuengirola Street market at Los Boliches.
frontmatter.description: Tuesday Fuengirola Street market at Los Boliches. - There is a market on Tuesdays and Saturdays. They are not identical markets in fact very different. Tuesdays would appeal to the typical tourists. New shoes, clothes, replica goods, handbags, football club shirts etc. Saturday is mainly second hand, used items sale.
tags: Top Free Things to do with Kids in Andalusia

frontmatter.title: Valdearenas lake in Iznájar
frontmatter.description: Valdearenas lake in Iznájar - The province of Córdoba does not have a beach, but just one hour inland from the southern coast of Spain, you find this freshwater lake in Iznajar. The lake  stretches for around 32km and offers everything you can find on a beach. The lake has lots of facilities and is a doggy paradise.

frontmatter.title: Valle Romano Golf & Resort
frontmatter.description: Valle Romano Golf & Resort - Improve your swing on the golf course or take a dip in one of the 2 outdoor pools at the hotel. There is an excellent golf course with difficult greens onsite, which has a great design but is quite challenging. The clubhouse is great and has beautiful views and good food.
tags: Top golf courses Costa del Sol

frontmatter.title: Valle del Este Golf Resort
frontmatter.description: Valle del Este Golf Resort - The resort is embedded on a magnificent golf course, on the top of a hill oriented to the sea, with beautiful views on a semi-desert landscape. Like an oasis of green, with palm trees and beautiful local flora, the golf course is perfectly integrated within the landscape. The 18-hole golf course has been carefully designed to combine holes that represent a real challenge to players, but also have less strenuous holes for beginners.

frontmatter.title: Ventura de Mar beach
frontmatter.description: Ventura de Mar beach - This beach has two designated dog-friendly zones. Dog owners are allowed to bring their pets without any time restrictions. Owners must be in full control of their dog at all times, carry proof of their dog’s vaccinations, respect other beach users and clean up any dog mess. The beach is not for swimming.

frontmatter.title: Vialia Shopping Centre
frontmatter.description: Vialia Shopping Centre - Located next to the train station and the coach station in Malaga with connections to Fuengirola . This shopping centre is not as big as some of the others, but has a good selection of shops.
tags: Top things to do in Andalusia when it rains

frontmatter.title: Viapol Center
frontmatter.description: Viapol Center - A small shopping center, close to the University with a gym, supermarket, Post Office and a few restaurants.

frontmatter.title: Villa Nueva Golf Resort
frontmatter.description: Villa Nueva Golf Resort - The resort is located in Puerto Real, a small town 10 minutes from Cádiz, 20 minutes from the Hotel Vincci Resort Costa Golf Course, and just 2 kilometers from the sea. The 18 holes golf course is beautiful, very well cared for and attended. The course is one of the few found in southern Spain with Bermuda grass.

frontmatter.title: Villa Padierna Golf Club
frontmatter.description: Villa Padierna Golf Club - Villa Padierna is one of the most spectacular golf resorts in southern Europe and the entire Mediterranean. The golf course was design by the prestigious architect Antonio García Garrido, it has 18 holes, 5,714 m. par 71 and is characterized by its careful landscaping. The course presents a challenge for any golfer. It is of generous dimensions, the streets are narrow in the first half of the route and more precision is required than in the second.
tags: Top golf courses Costa del Sol

frontmatter.title: Water Parks in the Sea (Sotogrande)
frontmatter.description: Water Parks in the Sea (Sotogrande) - Costa Water Parks is a local company which has inflatable and floating water parks at different locations along the coast. Also located in Puerto Banus, Mijas Costa, Fuengirola and Benalmádena (in front of Bil-Bil Castle)
tags: Top things to do with kids in Costa del Sol

frontmatter.title: Water Sport Playa Rafa - Jet Ski Rentals
frontmatter.description: Water Sport Playa Rafa - Jet Ski Rentals - Rent equipment for a thrilling adventure of parasailing, flyboarding, jet ski, wakeboarding and many more watersport activities.
tags: Top things to do with kids in Costa del Sol

frontmatter.title: Waterparks in the Sea (Benalmadena)
frontmatter.description: Waterparks in the Sea (Benalmadena) - Costa Water Parks is a local company which has inflatable and floating water parks at different locations along the coast. Also located in Sotogrande, Puerto Banus, Mijas Costa and Fuengirola.
tags: Top things to do with kids in Costa del Sol

frontmatter.title: Waterparks in the Sea (Fuengirola)
frontmatter.description: Waterparks in the Sea (Fuengirola) - Costa Water Parks is a local company which has inflatable and floating water parks at different locations along the coast. Also located in Sotogrande, Puerto Banus, Mijas Costa and Benalmádena (in front of Bil-Bil Castle)
tags: Top things to do with kids in Costa del Sol

frontmatter.title: Waterparks in the Sea (Mijas Costa)
frontmatter.description: Waterparks in the Sea (Mijas Costa) - Costa Water Parks is a local company which has inflatable and floating water parks at different locations along the coast. Also located in Sotogrande, Puerto Banus, Fuengirola and Benalmádena (in front of Bil-Bil Castle)
tags: Top things to do with kids in Costa del Sol

frontmatter.title: Waterparks in the Sea (Puerto Banus)
frontmatter.description: Waterparks in the Sea (Puerto Banus) - Costa Water Parks is a local company which has inflatable and floating water parks at different locations along the coast. Also located in Sotogrande, Mijas Costa, Fuengirola and Benalmádena (in front of Bil-Bil Castle)
tags: Top things to do with kids in Costa del Sol

frontmatter.title: Wednesday - Estepona market
frontmatter.description: Wednesday - Estepona market - Small market with stalls that are a great mix of items from aromatic spices, baby clothes, bedding, toys, shoes and jewellery, with fantastic choices for tourists and locals alike.
tags: Top Free Things to do with Kids in Andalusia

frontmatter.title: Wednesday- Alhaurin de la Torre street market
frontmatter.description: Tuesday- Alhaurin de la Torre street market - Street market in the old town every Wednesday from 9am to 2pm.
tags: Top Free Things to do with Kids in Andalusia

frontmatter.title: Yelmo Cines Plaza Mayor
frontmatter.description: Yelmo Cines Plaza Mayor - This cinema is situated in the Plaza Mayor shopping centre and show a good range of English films (VOSE)
tags: Top things to do in Andalusia when it rains
Top things to do with kids in Costa del Sol
Top things to do with kids in Malaga

frontmatter.title: Zaudín Club Golf
frontmatter.description: Zaudín Club Golf - Located 10 minutes from the center of Seville, this is a private members club. The club has a 18-hole golf course, designed by Gary Player, one of the most brilliant players in history. It is a parkland-type course, with two lakes strategically located, which affect the game at several holes.

frontmatter.title: Zoco Shopping
frontmatter.description: Zoco Shopping - The Souk of Cordoba is a Traditional Arab Market, located in a two-story Mudéjar building, with a porticoed courtyard, where artisans who make their products, expose themselves to the public eye. This shopping area is located in Calle Judíos, next to the Plaza de Maimónides, halfway between the Mosque-Cathedral and the Puerta de Almodóvar and is a must-visit in Cordoba.

frontmatter.title: Zoo de Castellar
frontmatter.description: Zoo de Castellar - Not your typical zoo, but a place where you can interact with the animals.
tags: Top things to do in Costa del Sol
